description.text: Fluid properties giving shapes for which fluid interactions are applicable; fluid density, and viscosity.
This density refers purely to fluid interactions and need not (though for 'correct' behaviour should) be of the same magnitude as the normal material density which gives the shape it's mass.
Like with normal material density, the units are g/px^2.

The higher the viscosity the more drag the objects will experiance as a result of fluid interactions. Viscosity is not implemented in the constraint solver and so may experiance occasional bad behaviour if you use very high values, normally values between 0 and 10 should be sufficient!
